intro: Sebaea trinervia, commonly known as the starry sebaea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are opposite and usually lance-shaped. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Sebaea trinervia is valued for its ornamental appeal and is cultivated in gardens for its attractive blooms.
